1:
You righteous people should shout joyfully to Yahweh\q2 because that is what he deserves.
\q1
2:
Praise Yahweh as you play songs on the harp.\q2 Praise him as you play harps that have ten strings.
\q1
3:
Sing a new song to him;\q2 play those instruments well, and shout joyfully as you play them.



\q1
4:
Yahweh always does what he says that he will do;\q2 we can trust that everything that he does is right.
\q1
5:
He loves everything that we do that is just and right.\q2 Yahweh helps people all over the earth because he always loves them.
\q1
6:
Yahweh created everything in the sky by commanding it.\q2 By what he commanded, he created all the stars.


\q1
7:
He gathered all the water into one huge mass\q2 like someone scoops liquid into a container.
\q1
8:
Everyone on the earth should honor Yahweh;\q2 everyone on the earth should honor him.
\q1
9:
When he spoke, he created the world.\q2 Everything started to exist when he commanded it to be.


\q1
10:
Yahweh stops the other nations from doing the things they want to do.\q2 He prevents them from doing the evil things that they plan to do.
\q1
11:
But what Yahweh decides to do will last forever.\q2 What he plans to do will never change.
\q1
12:
Yahweh blesses our nation, we who worship him;\q2 How fortunate are we, the nation that belongs to him forever!


\q1
13: Yahweh looks down from heaven and sees all people.\q1
14: From where he rules, he looks down on all the people who live on the earth.\q1
15:
He forms our inner beings,\q2 and he sees everything that we do.


\q1
16:
It is not because a king has a great army that he is able to win battles,\q2 and it is not because a soldier is very strong that he is able to defeat his enemy.
\q1
17:
It is foolish to think that because horses are very strong,\q2 they will be able to win a battle and save their riders.


\q1
18:
Do not forget that Yahweh watches over those who honor him,\q2 those who confidently expect him to faithfully love them.
\q1
19:
He saves them from dying before they should die;\q2 he preserves them when there is a famine.



\q1
20:
We trust Yahweh to help us;\q2 he protects us as a shield protects a soldier.
\q1
21:
We rejoice because of what he has done for us;\q2 we trust in him because he is holy.


\q1
22: Yahweh, we pray that you will always faithfully love us\q2 while we confidently expect you to do great things for us.
